00020 /**
00021  * SyncNode is the basic support for node objects in Sync.
00022  */
00023 
00024 #ifndef CCN_SyncNode
00025 #define CCN_SyncNode
00026 
00027 #include <stdio.h>
00028 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00029 #include "SyncMacros.h"
00030 
00031 struct SyncBaseStruct;  // defined in SyncBase.h
00032 struct SyncRootStruct;  // defined in SyncRoot.h
00033 
00034 typedef enum {
00035     SyncNodeKind_zero = 0,  /**< no bits set */
00036     SyncNodeKind_mark = 1   /**< mark bit (TBD) */
00037 } SyncNodeKind;
00038 
00039 typedef enum {
00040     SyncElemKind_node = 0,  /**< node */
00041     SyncElemKind_leaf = 1   /**< leaf */
00042 } SyncElemKind;
00043 
00044 struct SyncNodeElem {
00045     SyncElemKind kind;  /**< leaf/composite flag */
00046     ssize_t start;      /**< start of element encoding */
00047     ssize_t stop;       /**< stop of element encoding */
00048 };
00049 
00050 /**
00051  * A SyncLongHashStruct is used to accumulate a combined hash code
00052  * The pos field is the lowest index of a valid byte (bytes are accumulated
00053  * from high to low index).
00054  */
00055 struct SyncLongHashStruct {
00056     int pos;
00057     unsigned char bytes[MAX_HASH_BYTES];
00058 };
00059 
00060 /**
00061  * A SyncNodeComposite object holds the necessary data for a sync tree node.
00062  * It is the instantiated version, and there are routines for converting to
00063  * and from the ccnb encoded version, which has a very different format than
00064  * the type presented here.
00065  *
00066  * This type may be used while building a new node from components, and it may
00067  * be used for a node representation parsed from an external ccnb encoding.
00068  * 
00069  */
00070 struct SyncNodeComposite {
00071     struct SyncBaseStruct *base;
00072     SyncNodeKind kind;    /**< kind bits */
00073     int rc;               /**< reference count */
00074     int err;              /**< any error saved here */
00075     unsigned leafCount;   /**< leaf count (includes this node) */
00076     unsigned treeDepth;   /**< max tree depth (includes this node) */
00077     unsigned byteCount;   /**< byte count sum for child nodes (this node NOT included) */
00078     
00079     int refLen;           /**< number of references */
00080     int refLim;           /**< space allocated for references */
00081     struct SyncNodeElem *refs;    /**< pointer to references array */
00082     struct ccn_charbuf *cb;       /**< pointer to ccnb encoding */
00083     struct SyncLongHashStruct longHash;  /**< space for accumulated hash */
00084     struct ccn_charbuf *hash;     /**< combined hash (no tag, requires SyncEndComposite) */
00085     struct ccn_charbuf *minName;  /**< minimum name */
00086     struct ccn_charbuf *maxName;  /**< maximum name */
00087     struct ccn_charbuf *content;  /**< the signed content node (may be NULL) */
00088 };
00089 
00090 /**
00091  * Sets the error field when there is a processing error.
00092  */
00093 int
00094 SyncSetCompErr(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc, int val);
00095 
00096 /**
00097  * Tests the error field for an error returns 0 for no error != 0 for an error).
00098  */
00099 int
00100 SyncCheckCompErr(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * Makes a decoder from an offset range using the node charbuf.
00104  */
00105 struct ccn_buf_decoder *
00106 SyncInitDecoderFromOffset(struct ccn_buf_decoder *d,
00107                           struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00108                           ssize_t start, ssize_t stop);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * Makes a decoder from an element.
00112  */
00113 struct ccn_buf_decoder *
00114 SyncInitDecoderFromElem(struct ccn_buf_decoder *d,
00115                         struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00116                         struct SyncNodeElem *ep);
00117 
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * Increments the reference count
00121  */
00122 void
00123 SyncNodeIncRC(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00124 
00125 /**
00126  * Decrements the reference count
00127  * @returns nc if the resulting count is > 0.
00128  * @returns NULL if the resulting count == 0 (and frees the node).
00129  */
00130 struct SyncNodeComposite *
00131 SyncNodeDecRC(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00132

00136 ////////////////////////////////////////

00138 enum SyncCompareResult {
00139     SCR_before,
00140     SCR_min,
00141     SCR_inside,
00142     SCR_max,
00143     SCR_after,
00144     SCR_missing,
00145     SCR_error
00146 };
00147 
00148 /**
00149  * Compares a name against the min and max names in the node.
00150  */
00151 enum SyncCompareResult
00152 SyncNodeCompareMinMax(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc, struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00153 
00154 /**
00155  * Compares a name against the leaf in the element.
00156  */
00157 enum SyncCompareResult
00158 SyncNodeCompareLeaf(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00159                     struct SyncNodeElem *ep,
00160                     struct ccn_charbuf *name);

00162 ////////////////////////////////////////
00163 // Routines for building CompositeNodes
00164 ////////////////////////////////////////
00165 
00166 /**
00167  * resets a composite node to its initial state
00168  * except that it retains any allocated storage
00169  */
00170 void
00171 SyncResetComposite(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00172 
00173 /**
00174  * allocates a new, empty, composite object
00175  */
00176 struct SyncNodeComposite *
00177 SyncAllocComposite(struct SyncBaseStruct *base);
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * extends the references section of a composite object with a new offset pair
00181  * useful if NOT using SyncNodeAddName and SyncNodeAddNode
00182  */
00183 void
00184 SyncExtendComposite(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00185                     SyncElemKind kind,
00186                     ssize_t start, ssize_t stop);
00187 
00188 /**
00189  * maintains the minName and maxName bounds
00190  * useful if NOT using SyncNodeAddName and SyncNodeAddNode
00191  */
00192 void
00193 SyncNodeMaintainMinMax(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00194                        const struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00195 
00196 /**
00197  * extends the references section of a composite object with a new name,
00198  * updating the composite fields (including the name bounds)
00199  * the names MUST be added in sorted order!
00200  */
00201 void
00202 SyncNodeAddName(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00203                 const struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00204 
00205 /**
00206  * extends the references section of a composite object with a new node,
00207  * updating the composite fields (including the name bounds)
00208  * the nodes MUST be added in sorted order!
00209  */
00210 void
00211 SyncNodeAddNode(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc,
00212                 struct SyncNodeComposite *node);
00213 
00214 /**
00215  * appends the ccnb encoding for the long hash of nc to cb
00216  */
00217 int
00218 SyncNodeAppendLongHash(struct ccn_charbuf *cb, struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00219 
00220 /**
00221  * endComposite finishes up the encoding, appending the composite fields
00222  * the hash field will be valid after this call
00223  */
00224 void
00225 SyncEndComposite(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00226 
00227 /**
00228  * freeComposite returns the storage for the composite object
00229  */
00230 void
00231 SyncFreeComposite(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc);
00232 
00233 /**
00234  * writes the encoding to a file
00235  * (primarily useful for test and debug code)
00236  */
00237 void
00238 SyncWriteComposite(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc, FILE *f);
00239 
00240 /**
00241  * parses an encoded node and fills in the supplied node
00242  * implicitly resets the node at the start of the parse
00243  * @returns nc->err
00244  */
00245 int
00246 SyncParseComposite(struct SyncNodeComposite *nc, struct ccn_buf_decoder *d);

00248 struct SyncNodeComposite *
00249 SyncNodeFromBytes(struct SyncRootStruct *root, const unsigned char *cp, size_t cs);

00251 struct SyncNodeComposite *
00252 SyncNodeFromParsedObject(struct SyncRootStruct *root,
00253                          const unsigned char *msg,
00254                          struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco);

00256 struct SyncNodeComposite *
00257 SyncNodeFromInfo(struct SyncRootStruct *root,
00258                  struct ccn_upcall_info *info);
